result.title: Ball to Acquire Majority Stake in European Beverage Can Manufacturer Benepack
result.text: WESTMINSTER, Colo. , Dec. 10, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Ball Corporation (NYSE: BALL) today announced that it has entered into definitive agreements to acquire a majority stake in Benepack's beverage can manufacturing businesses in Europe consisting of its two production facilities in Belgium and Hungary.

result.title: Ball Corporation Announces Completion of Credit Facilities
result.text: WESTMINSTER, Colo. , Nov. 25, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Ball Corporation (NYSE: BALL) announced today it has completed the closing of its new revolver and term loan senior secured credit facilities that refinance its existing senior secured credit facilities entered into on June 28, 2022.

result.title: Ball Stock: Time To Stop Kicking The Can (Rating Upgrade)
result.text: Ball Corporation has refocused on its core aluminum can business after divesting its aerospace segment, improving financial simplicity and growth potential. Recent aggressive share buybacks have increased leverage, with net debt rising to $6.7 billion and leverage ratios now at 3.4x EBITDA. Despite solid per-share earnings growth and reasonable valuation, concerns remain about capital allocation and elevated leverage from buybacks at higher prices.
